title: Brent crude set for worst week since 1991 as oil falls a third day
text: Oil fell a third day as the horror show for crude investors continued on Friday amid panic about evaporating demand from the coronavirus pandemic, with Brent set for its biggest weekly loss since 1991 and U.S. crude heading for its worst week since 2008.

title: A History of Bear Markets
text: On March 11, 2020, the Dow Jones Industrial Average entered a bear market for the first time in 11 years.

title: Asian Stocks Extend Global Rout
text: Dan Fineman, co-head of APAC equity strategy at Credit Suisse, discusses the fall in Asian markets and what it will take to stop the rout.

title: Trump's ex-top economic adviser: US is in a recession
text: Former Director of the National Economic Council Gary Cohn speaks with CNN's Anderson Cooper about how the global coronavirus outbreak has impacted the US economy.

title: Oil falls a third day, Brent crude set for worst week since 1991
text: Oil prices fell on Friday for a third day, with Brent crude set for its biggest weekly drop since 1991 and U.S. crude heading for the worst week since 2008 as panic about plunging demand from the coronavirus outbreak grips the market.

title: What to Watch out for as U.S. Treasury yields fall.
text: Schwab's Collin Martin on what to watch out for as U.S. Treasury yields fall as the stock market enters into bear territory.

title: Dollar shines as pandemic drives rush for liquid assets
text: The dollar stood tall on Friday as investors scrambled for the world’s most liquid currency amid deepening panic about the coronavirus while the euro nursed losses after the European Central Bank disappointed investors by not cutting rates.

title: U.S. excludes some Chinese medical products from tariffs
text: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said it granted on Thursday exclusions from import tariffs for some medical products imported from China, including face masks, stethoscope covers and blood pressure cuff sleeves.

title: Citi Oil Veteran Says $20s Likely on Unique Demand-Supply Shock
text: Commodities tumbled with global markets as efforts by policy makers across the world failed to reassure investors worried over the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

title: 'The only way to beat COVID-19 is to risk a recession,' Jim Cramer says
text: "If we don't do something like this six-part plan, we're going to have a serious financial emergency on top of the public health emergency," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

title: Market turmoil sparked by coronavirus fears is worse than financial crisis, James Bianco says
text: Bianco Research's James Bianco warns the Fed's massive move to calm markets during the coronavirus pandemic may not work.

title: Coronavirus Ends Bull-Run
text: The 11-year Bull Run may have finally come to an end but do not fret because opportunity is on the horizon.

title: Eulogy To The Bull Market, Aged 11 Years And A Few Days
text: The S&P 500 bull market died on Thursday after an 11-year run that returned 400% and tripled earnings. It was the longest run in history and preceded in a day by its brother, The Dow.

title: Big banks have cash to help some industries in short-term crisis, but for others the pain may come later
text: The country's largest banks are ready to lend to companies facing a cash squeeze spurred by the coronavirus pandemic. But some of America's weakest companies may not be able to withstand the longer-term impact.

title: Wells Fargo's Harvey: Unclear when bleeding will stop, but we're beginning to see opportunity
text: Wells Fargo's Chris Harvey on the market's historic 10 percent drop today, and what he's looking to buy.

title: World markets rout deepens as virus panic worsens
text: Asia's stock markets were hammered on Friday as panic gripping world financial markets deepened and even safe-haven assets such as gold and bonds were ditched to cover losses in the wipeout.

title: Wall Street Suffers Worst Rout Since Black Monday as Virus Response Eludes Washington
text: The government’s lack of response and the economic fallout from the coronavirus fueled a steep sell-off in stocks and prompted cancellations and closings around the country.

title: BNEF Brief: How the Global Travel, Visa Bans Are Hitting the Jet Fuel Market
text: A U.S. ban on Schengen area flights issued on March 11 may disrupt over 180,000 b/d of jet fuel demand. On "Bloomberg Commodities Edge", Bloomberg's Alix Steel talks with David Doherty, oil demand specialist at BloombergNEF. More than 50,000 barrels per day (b/d) of jet fuel demand is at risk after India restricted visas for all non-nationals on March 12. The ban will remain in place until April 15.

title: Wall Street dazed and confused after worst day since 1987
text: As trading ended on Thursday in Wall Street's worst day for three decades, shell-shocked investors had no idea how much further the market was likely to fall as the coronavirus pandemic spread fear of a global recession.

title: Wall Street sell-off batters bitcoin, pounds palladium as investors go to cash
text: Crushing asset sell-offs ranging from bitcoin to precious metals and European stocks accompanied Wall Street's slide into bear market territory on Thursday, as investors liquidated positions across their portfolios to raise cash.

title: Just how bad is this sell-off going to get?
text: Erin Gibbs, Gibbs Wealth Management, and Savita Subramanian, Bank of America Merrill Lynch, discuss what was behind today's 10 percent drop in the Dow.

title: 'Massive federal intervention' is needed to prevent the health crisis from becoming a financial one,
text: "If we don't do something like this six-part plan, we're going to have a serious financial emergency on top of the public health emergency," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

title: 'The only way to beat COVID-19 I believe is to risk a recession,' Jim Cramer says
text: "If we don't do something like this six-part plan, we're going to have a serious financial emergency on top of the public health emergency," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

title: NY Fed to offer $500 billion in 3-month repo operation
text: Yahoo Finance’s Brian Cheung joins Seana Smith on The Ticker to discuss the details of the Fed’s repo announcement.

title: Dow suffers biggest one-day-plunge since 1987, dropping over 10%
text: All three indexes closed lower amid coronavirus fears, with the Dow having the single worst day since 1987, dropping over 10%.

title: Elizabeth Warren presents $750 billion 'grassroots' plan to address coronavirus crisis
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer talked with Sen. Elizabeth Warren about her "big stimulus package" worth $750 billion to expand COVID-19 testing and reach student loan holders, workers and businesses.

title: The markets reset, and key levels to watch
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani reports on today's market hit. And Fundstrat's Robert Sluymer give key levels to watch. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: US stock futures down after 11-year bull market run ended Thursday
text: Wall Street has officially ended its longest bull market run in history, and stock futures continued to dip when futures trading started Thursday evening.

title: Three Ways The Coronavirus Stock Market Correction May Play Out
text: The coronavirus stock market correction is a bear market. How bad it gets depends on how well governments control the Covid-19 crisis.

title: Scott Minerd explains today's nearly 10% sell-off
text: Guggenheim Global CIO Scott Minerd discusses today's massive sell-off. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: Stocks plunge 8% as Federal Reserve fails to calm investor fears
text: Adam Taback, CIO of Wells Fargo Private Bank, joined Yahoo Finance to break down the market volatility and how he is advising clients.

title: Coronavirus Stock Correction Sparks Huge Turnover On IBD Watchlists
text: See which stocks have just been added to – or removed from – IBD’s stock lists, including the IBD 50, Sector Leaders, IBD Big Cap 20 and IPO Leaders.

title: This whole coronavirus... sell-off has been a panic,.
text: Tigress Financial Partners Chief Investment Officer Ivan Feinseth joins Yahoo Finance's Zack Guzman to discuss boeing and other stocks that are getting hammered in market.

title: How the Worst Day Since 1987 Compares to the Real Stock Market Crash of 1987
text: March 12, 2020 will go down in the history books as the worst trading day since the stock market crash in October of 1987.

title: The 11-Year Bull Run Is Coming To An End
text: The markets halted trading for the second time this week after the major indexes fell over 7% in the first 10 minutes, and exhibited the worst 1-day loss since the flash crash in 1987

title: Stock futures point to more losses Friday following market's worst day since 'Black Monday'
text: Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost about 200 points shortly after the open of overnight trading Thursday.

title: The Fed to the rescue?
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman reports on today's Fed action. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: With stocks selling off as rapidly as 1987, some analysts wonder if they can bounce as fast too
text: Analysts are comparing the stock market's swift selloff to the crash of 1987 because both markets reached bear market territory quickly.

title: 2020 Bear Market Demystified in Bullet Points
text: 2020 Bear Market is the largest since 2008. Today stocks plunged even as Central Banks stepped in.

title: The Dow Just Had Its Biggest Drop Since 1987: Here's Why
text: The stock market continued its crash on Thursday.

title: Weitz Funds Market Perspective: What's Happening Now With the Coronavirus?
text: Since publishing our commentary on the coronavirus last month, we have seen the situation develop and intensify every day — practically every hour.

title: Wall Street empties out as New York City declares state of emergency
text: Working from home went from optional to mandatory across Wall Street this week as financial firms reported their first confirmed cases of coronavirus and the outbreak triggered a state of emergency in New York City.

title: “Be Greedy When Others Are Fearful”
text: As I write mid-day on Thursday, U.S. stocks have extended losses after another trading halt this morning.

title: US Fed injects $1.5tn to markets as Dow and FTSE suffer worst day since 1987
text: Indices on both sides of the Atlantic suffer biggest one-day slide since Black Monday

title: Panic grips financial markets after U.S. travel curbs, ECB move
text: Panic hit world financial markets on Thursday after stimulus efforts from the European Central Bank failed to calm investors alarmed by U.S. moves to restrict travel from Europe because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Historic market plunge: Traders describe a day that went from 'uncertainty to panic'
text: Traders reacted to stocks' steep sell-off on Thursday, which saw the Dow Jones Industrial Average post its largest daily percentage drop since the 1987 crash.

title: Some Oil Stocks May Be ‘Uninvestable’ During the Price War
text: Saudi Arabia, the de facto leader of OPEC, failed to reach a production cut agreement with non-OPEC Russia on March 6, causing both countries to ramp up production.

title: Too early to predict whether we will have a recession: Fmr. Treasury Sec.
text: Former Treasury Secretary Jack Lew joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the economy and the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell Stocks Right Now
text: Investing for the long term almost always pays off, but there are times when selling's the right move.

title: The credit markets are signaling that a bigger problem is afoot despite the Fed's interventions
text: While much of the attention in the bond market has been focused on the Treasury side, corporate fixed income has been in its own state of turmoil.
